backend

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • databaseConnectors.DatabaseManager
      • backend.User

  • public class User
extends DatabaseManager
    Class that creates a user and has functionality associated with the user.

      • User

        public User(java.lang.String username)
        Constructs a new User Object. Sets all the instance variables based on the username, with data from the database.
        Parameters:
        username - username of the user

    • Method Detail

      • updatePassword

        public boolean updatePassword(java.lang.String newPassword)
        Updates the password of the user, crypts it and sends it into the database.
        Parameters:
        newPassword - the new password that the user is going to have
        Returns:
        boolean true if successful, false if not

      • updatePassword

        public boolean updatePassword(java.lang.String oldpassword,
                              java.lang.String newPassword1,
                              java.lang.String newPassword2)
        Updates the password of the user, crypts it and sends it into the database. If the old password is not correct, the password will not be updated and it will return false. if newPassword1, and newPassword2 is not equal, the password will not be updated, and it will return false. If they are equal, and the oldpassword is the same at the actual old password in the database, the password will be updated, and it will return true.
        Parameters:
        oldpassword - the user's old password
        newPassword1 - the user's new password
        newPassword2 - the user's new password
        Returns:
        boolean true if updated, false if not

      • updatePasswordSql

        public boolean updatePasswordSql(java.lang.String cryptedPassword)
        Updates the user's password in the database.
        Parameters:
        cryptedPassword - the new password
        Returns:
        boolean true if successful, false if not

      • updateInfo

        public boolean updateInfo(java.lang.String newData,
                          java.lang.String columnName)
        Updates a chosen column in the user table in the database with new data.
        Parameters:
        newData - the new data the will be sent into the database
        columnName - the name of the column that it will be sent to
        Returns:
        boolean true if successful, false if not
